page.title: 01Introduction.
page.content: Elkstone is a small village (population is about 150), lying just off the Ermin Way, the former Roman road that now links Gloucester and Cirencester. The village has a largely farming economy, although some residents commute to nearby towns. Elkstone lies in a valley on the dip slope of the Cotswolds and is therefore typical of settlements in the area which avoid the more exposed tops. There are many Cotswold stone houses and cottages in Elkstone, but despite its idyllic appearance the relative isolation and the lack of local amenities create difficulties for those without access to a car. Away from the village there are many large farms and the only retail outlet, the Highwayman Inn on the Ermin Way.
